messages.content:
You are a world state generator for a workplace benchmark. Your job is to transform an abstract scenario into a concrete, detailed world_state JSON.

The world_state should include:
1. All metadata from the scenario (scenario_id, description, noise_level, depth, global_settings, people, projects)
2. sub_scenarios_expanded: For each abstract sub_scenario from the input scenario, create a concrete expanded version with:
   - Concrete ISO datetime timestamps
   - Specific participant IDs/emails
   - Detailed event descriptions
   - Any seeds needed for data generation
   - This array should contain ONLY the expanded versions of the sub_scenarios listed in the input scenario
3. noise_scenarios: An array of noise-only scenario objects that are NOT part of the core sub_scenarios:
   - These should be realistic but unrelated workplace events/messages/activities
   - Each noise scenario should have similar structure to sub_scenarios_expanded (id, type, timestamps, participants, etc.)
   - The number of noise scenarios should scale with the noise_level parameter

IMPORTANT: Do NOT include per_source_plans in the world_state. The world_state is scenario-centric only.

IMPORTANT PARAMETERS:
- noise_level (0-1): Controls amount of unrelated/off-task data
  * 0 = almost no noise, only data directly relevant to sub_scenarios (noise_scenarios should be empty or minimal)
  * 1 = lots of unrelated messages/events/files (still realistic) (noise_scenarios should contain many entries)
- depth (0-1): Controls how indirect the evidence is
  * 0 = sub_scenario realized directly (e.g., one clear Slack message)
  * 1 = sub_scenario requires multi-step, multi-source chaining to infer
  * Intermediate values interpolate behavior

CRITICAL: sub_scenarios_expanded must correspond exactly to the sub_scenarios in the input scenario. All other unrelated scenarios should go in noise_scenarios.

You must output ONLY valid JSON matching the world_state schema. Do not include markdown code fences.

raw_message.content:

    {

      "participants": [
        {
          "id": "person_alex_smith",
          "email": "alex.smith@company.com",
          "role": "PM"
        },
        {
          "id": "person_jordan_johnson",

          "role": "Engineer"
        },
        {
          "id": "person_sam_williams",
          "email": "sam.williams@company.com",
          "role": "Senior Engineer"
        },
        {
          "id": "person_taylor_brown",
          "email": "taylor.brown@company.com",
          "role": "Lead Engineer"
        },

        "target_week_end": "2025-11-21"

          "source": "slack",

            "person_taylor_brown",

          "content": "Hey @Jordan @Sam @Taylor @Casey,\n\nDAT-101 is getting more complex than we expected. Can we do a 1h sync next week to align on the Data Migration plan and dependencies?\n\nIdeally sometime between Monday and Thursday during working hours (09:00–18:00 KST). Please drop your available 1-hour slots and any hard conflicts.\n\nGoal: finalize scope for the Planning milestone next week."

          "to": [
            "person_alex_smith"
          ],
          "subject": null,
          "description": "Jordan shares availability and mentions an existing team standup.",
          "content": "Thanks Alex.\n\nNext week (KST):\n- Mon 17th: free except 10:00–10:30 for Eng standup\n- Tue 18th: blocked 14:00–17:00 for infra maintenance\n- Wed 19th: mostly free except 11:00–12:00 (1:1 with Morgan)\n- Thu 20th: prefer mornings, afternoons might fill up with code reviews.\n\nA 1h block on Mon 17th around 14:00–16:00 or Wed 19th after 15:00 would work well for me."
        },

          "event_id": "planning_meeting_complex_1_sam_availability",
          "source": "email",
          "timestamp": "2025-11-13T10:25:00+09:00",
          "from": "person_sam_williams",

            "person_taylor_brown",
            "person_casey_jones"
          ],

          "content": "Subject: Re: Data Migration sync next week\n\nHi Alex,\n\nFor next week (Nov 17–21, KST):\n- Mon 17: busy 13:00–15:00 (code review with infra), otherwise open.\n- Tue 18: open 09:00–12:00, booked 13:00–18:00.\n- Wed 19: open 09:00–11:00 and 16:00–18:00.\n- Thu 20: already has two long meetings, would rather avoid adding another 1h.\n\nIf we need everyone from Eng + R&D, my preference would be **Mon 17th 10:30–11:30** or **Wed 19th 16:00–17:00**.\n\nBest,\nSam"

Mon 17th mid-afternoon could also work if we avoid 13:00–15:00 (for Sam) and 10:00–10:30 (Jordan’s standup)."

          "content": "Subject: Re: Data Migration sync next week\n\nHi all,\n\nI’m fairly flexible next week except for a design critique on Wed 19th 13:00–14:00 and an R&D review on Tue 18th 15:00–16:00.\n\nBoth of the suggested times, **Mon 17th 10:30–11:30** and **Wed 19th 16:00–17:00**, are open on my side.\n\nThanks,\nCasey"

            "end": "2025-11-17T11:30:00+09:00",

        },

            "person_casey_jones"

          "content": "Thanks everyone for the quick responses.\n\nLet’s lock the **Data Migration planning sync** for **Wed, Nov 19th, 16:00–17:00 KST**.\n\nI’ll send a calendar invite titled \"DAT Planning Sync\" with an agenda focused on:\n- Finalizing scope for Planning milestone\n- Identifying blockers for DAT-101\n- Aligning R&D and Eng responsibilities.\n\nIf anything changes, please ping me directly."
